title: Wire up VO pipeline in main.cpp
description:
Connect the existing components to create an end-to-end visual odometry pipeline:
- Load images from KITTI dataset using ImageLoader
- Detect features using FeatureDetector
- Match features between consecutive frames using FeatureMatcher
- Estimate motion using MotionEstimator
- Accumulate poses in Trajectory
- Output trajectory JSON for visualization

The components exist but main.cpp is currently a placeholder.
close_reason: Full VO pipeline wired up and tested end-to-end

title: Design feature matcher abstraction for multiple backends
description:
Create an abstraction layer for feature matching that supports multiple backends:
- ORB (current OpenCV implementation)
- MatchAnything (learned matcher from ZJU)

Design decisions needed:
1. Runtime vs compile-time selection (or both?)
2. Interface design - both matchers have different APIs
3. ORB: detect + match separately
4. MatchAnything: end-to-end matching on image pairs

Consider using std::variant or virtual interface.
close_reason: Implemented ImageMatcher abstraction with virtual interface, OrbImageMatcher, factory function, and CLI --matcher flag

description: Include sample image sequence or instructions for downloading KITTI/TUM dataset for testing
close_reason: Superseded by smaller incremental tasks

title: Export MatchAnything to ONNX for C++ inference
description: Export the MatchAnything (zju-community/matchanything_eloftr) HuggingFace model to ONNX format. This enables pure C++ inference without Python runtime dependency. Steps: 1) Load model with transformers, 2) Export with torch.onnx.export(), 3) Validate output matches PyTorch version, 4) Optimize with onnx-simplifier if needed.

title: Match ORB features between two images
description: Use BFMatcher to match ORB descriptors between frame0 and frame1. Apply ratio test. Visualize matches with drawMatches(). ~30 min
close_reason: Created FeatureMatcher with Lowe's ratio test. All 5 new tests pass (19 total).

title: Fix viser API compatibility in visualize_trajectory.py

AttributeError: 'ViserServer' object has no attribute 'port'

File: scripts/visualize_trajectory.py:92

Need to update to use current viser API for getting server URL/port.
close_reason: Fixed viser API: changed server.port to server.get_port()

title: Integrate MatchAnything feature matcher
description:
Integrate MatchAnything (zju3dv) as an alternative feature matcher.

References:
- GitHub: https://github.com/zju3dv/MatchAnything
- HuggingFace weights: zju-community/matchanything_eloftr
- Based on ELoFTR architecture

Technical considerations:
- Requires PyTorch (libtorch C++ API or Python interop)
- 40ms per 640x480 image pair on RTX 3090
- Weights need to be downloaded from HuggingFace

Options for integration:
1. libtorch (PyTorch C++ frontend)
2. pybind11 Python interop
3. Subprocess with IPC
close_reason: Implemented MatchAnythingMatcher via Python subprocess. Requires: pip install transformers torch

title: Implement VO processing loop in main.cpp
description:
Main processing loop that:
1. Load consecutive image pairs using next_pair()
2. Detect ORB features in both images
3. Match features between frames
4. Estimate motion using essential matrix + RANSAC
5. Accumulate pose in Trajectory
6. Print progress (frame N/M, inliers, etc.)

Continue until no more image pairs or max-frames reached.
close_reason: Processing loop implemented: detectmatchestimateaccumulate with progress output
